meanings.definition: The office or position of a deacon.
meanings.sent1: In the diaconate, deacons assist the priest during church services.
meanings.sent2: She was honored to be appointed to the diaconate in her local church.
meanings.sent3: The diaconate was so busy that they accidentally mixed up the communion wine with grape juice.
meanings.sent4: The diaconate stood strong and united, supporting the church community through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The diaconate's role was crucial in ensuring the smooth running of the church's operations.

meanings.definition: The rank or status of a deacon.
meanings.sent1: His dedication and hard work earned him a high position in the diaconate.
meanings.sent2: The diaconate was respected for their commitment to serving the congregation.
meanings.sent3: When he received the diaconate, he felt a sense of pride and responsibility.
meanings.sent4: She aspired to reach the highest level in the diaconate hierarchy.
meanings.sent5: The diaconate's authority was evident in their interactions with parishioners.

meanings.definition: The collective body of deacons in a particular church.
meanings.sent1: The diaconate met every Sunday to discuss community outreach programs.
meanings.sent2: Members of the diaconate worked together to address the needs of the church.
meanings.sent3: During the potluck, the diaconate shared stories of their experiences in service.
meanings.sent4: The diaconate's unity and camaraderie were admired by all in the congregation.
meanings.sent5: Being part of the diaconate meant being part of a supportive and caring community.
